ISSUE.TITLE: cors problem while labeling
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: I have started the server,created a account,and imported my data by a .txt file,but when i start to label my data,i get an error below.I just don't know why i have imported my data but get an error like this while labeling.And my .txt file is below,i start LS by 'label-studio',data server by 'python -m http.server 8081 -d'. cors problem: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42054022/120612188-83745380-c487-11eb-9c8a-dc3cd245414c.png) .txt file: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42054022/120612276-9e46c800-c487-11eb-94cc-7e06ea491b24.png) data server console error: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42054022/120613007-5f654200-c488-11eb-8e5b-fca317847380.png) It says an existing connection was forcibly closed by the remote host.

BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: Update page.ejs Updating slack footer formatting that got bungled when I was fixing merge conflicts, sigh

Doc updates and fixes (#1040) * Update image_units.md Updating to remove an error that max discovered * Update page.ejs Updating slack footer formatting that got bungled when I was fixing merge conflicts, sigh * update CORS guidance Update CORS guidance per issue #1013 and fixed a couple broken links * Remove/deprecate ml-backends command Per issue #996, the ml-backends command is actually deprecated and doesn't work. Updating the documentation accordingly. * Update install_enterprise.md Update for customer issue encountered when logging in * Add result and region ID info add info about result and region IDs * Fix misspell * Update page.styl Fixing typo * Delete annotation_ids.md Removing for now, will put in another PR Co-authored-by: makseq-ubnt <makseq@gmail.com>
